intro: Spigelia persicarioides var. insularis, commonly known as the island coralroot, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, coral-like inflorescence that resembles a cluster of small, fleshy flowers. The plant is hemiparasitic, meaning it partially relies on host plants for nutrients through its root system. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
